actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to provide a deduction for income tax purposes in the case of a disabled individual, for expenses for transportation to and from work; and to provide an additional exemption for income tax purposes for a taxpayer or spouse who is disabled.

summary.text: Allows a tax deduction, under the Internal Revenue Code, of up to $750 for transportation expenses incurred to and from work by a disabled individual as one who is blind or who has lost the use of one or more of his extremities to such an extent that he is unable to use, without undue hardship or danger, a streetcar, bus, subway, or train. Provides an additional exemption of $750 for income tax purposes for a taxpayer or spouse who is disabled.

titles.title: A bill to provide a deduction for income tax purposes in the case of a disabled individual, for expenses for transportation to and from work; and to provide an additional exemption for income tax purposes for a taxpayer or spouse who is disabled.
